message.content:
cs.NI, cs.CR, cs.SY, cs.AI, cs.CV 

This paper is likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) as it deals with the use of wireless infrastructure for indoor localization. It could also belong to cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) as it discusses intrusion detection and border protection. Additionally, it could be categorized under cs.SY (Systems and Control) as it involves the design and implementation of a system for human motion detection. The use of statistical anomaly detection and adaptation to changes in the environment suggests that it could also be classified under cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) or cs.CV (Computer Vision) as these fields often involve similar techniques.
